topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54067f6d6368721b98d20100#post_54067f6d6368721b98d20100
Serious answer to stupid question posed by tumbler fuckhead: There are two very good reasons not to do that, the first is the premise of banning cruel and unusual punishment for any crime no matter how heinous, the simple moral reason being that if we are to be just then we must not stoop to the cruelties of the unjust.

The second and related reason is the simple fallibility of the law. However iron clad the case seems there may be circumstances that later exonerate the accused, exoneration that would do a fat lot of good to the poor sod who had his genitalia unjustly destroyed.

This is also why I am morally opposed to the death penalty.

Once you crush the genitals of a single innocent person you reveal that your concern is neither justice or care of the victim, but rather is simply vengeance driven blood lust.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540686156368723261e50100#post_540686156368723261e50100
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540685b86368720780d30100#post_540685b86368720780d30100

I want to believe this one...


"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/540685c3636872646c2c0000#post_540685c3636872646c2c0000

But this guy is the computer expert. Please enlighten me!!![/bq]
CMYK stands for cyan, magenta, yellow and black.  You're using the wrong printer settings in that the generic color settings is cmyk; what you want to use for black and white is black and white.  There's three major printing settings, rgb is crap color and you never use it professionally, cmyk is better, black and white and you use this to save money when printing books and such.  If you use cmyk when printing black and white it'll use all the colors, if you use black and white it'll just use black.
Dude's bullshiting you.
<Degree in printing
